Name: Allegiance Sworn (A Novel of the Light Blade)

ReviewList.Text: I was perfect .... it made me cry, it made me smile, it made me long for the next book.
This series is golden. Vengeance Born, Allegiance Forged, and now Alliance Sworn. The characters are well developed and the story pulls you in they are all very hard to put down.

While the second book in this series felt almost like a filler or a chapter in the story, Arec's story is a return the main theme. Picking up on the final leg of his journey into Na Reish territory, what looks like an opportunity to escape puts Arek into the middle of a betrayal of the Kaal clan that has been years in the making. Once again Arek is forced to face and question the beliefs he has been raised on by his grandfather as startling discoveries both of the histories shared between the races and those he has befriended. Coming to terms with unresolved feelings regarding his half sister, Varian and his kin and his feelings for Imhara, the Na Reish leader of the Kaal Clan who faces her own challenges both personal and for the hopes and dreams of her clan. War is on the threshhold and time is of the essence if Imhara's plan to succeed.
Excellent characters and descriptions.  I loved reading the whole series and I am now waiting impatiently for the next book.

I really like this series, its different and exciting.  I believe this is the third one in the series and you should definately pick up the others before reading this one or you might be a little confused.  While this one wasn't my favorite in the series, it was still good and nothing that I would chuck into the bin if I had bought the paperback addition.  I will say that the male/female roles were a little reversed and it was a little off putting for me personally.  Arek was a little like your slightly whiney woe is me victorian-ish maiden, and Imhara was the more understanding strong role.  Not to be sexist, but come on... this IS a romance novel haha.  I would still recommend this book to others though.

This is another installment in the Light Blade series and I loved it this one is sensual and amazing as Arek and Imhara learn to trust themselves and come to terms with their revenge. So many things are happening and it was wonderful catching up with other characters the strength of these help make this story great I could hardly put it down WOW.
